text:
JUST IN: Alameda County elementary schools can reopen for in-person learning on Oct. 13 if they complete a reopening plan, officials announced. There is no requirement that schools or school districts reopen at that time.

https://t.co/RvR9vfJpGB

name: sfchronicle
text: For the first time since 2006, the #Athletics won a playoff series. It wasn‚Äôt easy, it wasn‚Äôt pretty, it wasn‚Äôt noisy, writes @annkillion. But it was a playoff series win. For the first time in 14 long and often agonizing seasons. https://t.co/MRNFJiWU7U

text:
The Napa County Board of Supervisors held a special meeting Thursday to ratify a state of emergency and public health emergency that officials declared on Monday after the Glass Fire erupted.

 "We all feel sucker-punched," one supervisor said. https://t.co/ClZm6NOrGS

name: sfchronicle
text: Services allowed to reopen indoors on Oct. 9 in Alameda County include: hotels catering to tourists, museums and libraries (25% capacity), personal care services (so long as people wear masks at all times), and gyms (10% capacity). https://t.co/QnYUOEuiPw

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Francisco voters should start seeing ballots in their mailboxes next week. Starting Monday, you can vote under a massive tent at the Civic Center. The deadline to register to vote is Oct. 19.

text:
Firefighters had ‚Äúa very successful day‚Äù in their efforts to rein in the Zogg Fire near Redding, according to Cal Fire. The blaze consumed 55,803 acres as of Thursday evening, and the 39% containment is up from the 26% reported earlier in the day.
